text: Crickets. A spring night in rural Virginia. MILDRED(18) seems nervous. Her eyes cast down. She’s beautiful. A slender, light skinned black woman. High cheekbones hint at a mix of Native American ancestry. She picks her head up and takes a deep breath. Her big br eyes are soft in the light of the front porch.

I’m pregnant. RICHARD(24) listens. He’s a white man with close cropped blonde hair and a dark neck burned from working outside. He takes in the information. A smile breaks across his face, revealing a mouth full of crooked teeth. He quickly draws his lips over them, swallowing the smile. He’s shy, self-conscious of the tee He begins to nod, a more reserved smile coming through.

Good. That’s real good. At this, Mildred’s shoulders drop with relief. They sit close to one another on the front steps of a one story wood planked house. It’s 1958. They are young, but a rural working life makes them seem older than their years. Richard takes her hand. She leans into him. An ominous SOUND grows in the distance. A rumbling like thunder. It builds.

The chassis on an early 50’s Chevy rocks back and forth a gas charges through the idling motor. VIRGIL(25) continues to rev the car as he steals a glance his competition, another bulked up American machine prime explode off the starting line. Virgil is a mustached black man with thick eyebrows. He wears a bowler hat and clinches a toothpick in his teeth. catches the OTHER DRIVER’s eye, a white man. Virgil smile  A Man snaps a rag into the air. Tires smoke. Rubber streaks the asphalt as the cars light out down the strip. Richard pops off the hood of a parked car and tracks the race. He’s part of a GROUP gathered on the dirt swath tha borders the track. Mildred is with her sister GARNET(20), a woman of similar features and beauty. The Group of seven is made up of bla and whites. Most hold cans of beer. All follow the race. The two cars race neck and neck, their chrome bumpers straining for the lead. Virgil’s car manages to pull ahea Standing by Richard are RAYMOND(20), a thick-necked black who is easy to smile when not sweating a race, and PERCY( a tall man who watches more than he talks. At Virgil’s ca taking the lead, Raymond’s hand comes up.

There goes. The other Driver leans into the wheel as if to aid his chances, but it doesn’t help. Virgil manages a car length lead as he tears across the finish line. He yells and punches at the roof. Richard’s arm flies up, but he’s silent. Raymond lets out whooping sound before swinging out his massive palm which Richard meets with a slap. The Group cheers behind them. Richard walks back to Mildred, but on his way...
Timing’s still off ‘bout two degrees.
Looked fine to me. (to Percy) What you think?
I think we won. Mildred runs up and gives Richard a big hug.
Virgil and Percy stand in front of the other Driver and h CREW, all white, as the Driver counts a stack of cash out places it in Virgil’s outstretched bowler hat.

Now that’s just fine right there, I told them ‘bout ya’ll that you boys have ya’ll’s, yes keep on now, you boys have a fast car right there but ya’ll is fine to let us race wit you. Virgil's words come out in a jumble, making their meaning nearly imperceptible though their intention is clear. The money counted, Virgil sets the cash filled hat on his head and nods at the other Driver. He cuts a smile at Per before they turn back to join their own group. The disgruntled men rest against their beaten car. Their attention is not on Virgil’s collection, but rather on Richard and Mildred across the track. Richard holds Mildred close, kissing her proudly. The Cre just stares across at them, visibly seething.
A hillbilly house party in full swing. A few cars come and go, but most are parked in an array around the yard. People spill out of the tiny house.

The shack is brimming with bodies, thick smoke and booze. Laughter and shouts fill in amidst fast paced fiddles, ba and upright bass pounding out a bluegrass stomp. The crowd is mostly black, though a few whites are mingle throughout. Many look to be Native American. Richard, his arm around Mildred, clutches a beer and struggles to shout his point into Raymond’s ear. An inaudible reply from Raymond brings a red faced gut laugh from Richard. Percy looks over to see what was so funny. Virgil bumps through the crowd half dancing while careful balancing his jar of clear liquor. He bows the drink to Mildred, but Garnet’s hand swoops in to take it. Garnet wags a finger before taking an eyebrow raising si the stout stuff. She eyes Mildred, who smiles back at her Virgil pulls Garnet up to dance not forgetting to reclaim drink. He proceeds to dance in a way that spreads the cro Mildred nudges Richard. They laugh watching their friends dance, happy in this pl

Mortar is thrown onto a brick and buttered with a jointer before another brick comes down on top. It’s a rhythmic task, done with precision. Richard stands in front of a growing wall amongst several OTHER MEN laying brick at a bustling job site.
Damn Richard. Slow down. Richard smiles to himself. He finishes out his course of bricks and quickly gathers his tools. Walking away...
All right now.
Where you goin’? Richard doesn’t answer. He moves toward a collection of c parked nearby.

A light breeze moves through full summer leaves shading a hillside. Grass bends in a low-lying field down below. Richard’s feet move heel to toe, counting out a length. Still in his work clothes, he pauses and stares out at th field down below before finally turning to Mildred. Time has passed since seeing her last. A growing belly sh six months of her pregnancy. She watches him curiously.
Do you like it?
Like what?
Right here. This spot.
You mean this field?
Yeah.
This field not a mile from my house that I’ve been knowin’ all my life?
Yeah. She cocks her head at him, puzzled by this.
Yes. I like it. Richard breaks away and faces the lower field again.
I'd put the kitchen back here.
Richard stop this. I don’t know what you’re sayin’.

I bought it. This whole acre. I’m gonna build you a house right here. Our house. Mildred is speechless. Her eyes wander over the ground as seeing it for the first time. She barely notices Richard move close, taking her hand. Her eyes finally meet his. He looks serious.
Mildred?
Feet rushing through tall grass, dodging in and out and brambles. Mildred, as best she can carrying the extra weight, through a grove of trees. 7 of limbs darts

The tobacco field is vast, bordered on one side by a thic of trees and falling off to a horizon on the other. The sun is quickly setting behind the field, but a DOZEN PEOPLE, black and white, still toil there. They slouch ov the plants, weeding grass from between thick green leaves Mildred emerges from the thicket of trees, moving fast. S rushes into the field weaving between rows. Garnet barely straightens before Mildred has grabbed her the hand and pulls her away from her work.
What’s this now? Garnet is led out of the field back into the trees.
Fireflies have begun to rise in the grove. Mildred is tuc against a tree in the midst of a whisper to her sister.
Said he'd bought it for me. And then he asked me to marry him.
No he didn’t.
Yes. Mildred’s hand covers her mouth trying to contain her excitement.
Right out in the field? Oh Lord that man might be crazy. When you gonna do it?
He didn’t say. Soon though. Before the baby comes. Garnet’s eyes move upward as she takes in a long breath. seems troubled.
He’s gonna take my sister from me.  10 11

No. We'll be right down the road. Garnet takes Mildred’s hand and holds it to her face. Mildred smiles, which leads her sister to as well. They giggle at one another as evening takes hold. EXT. LOLA’S HOUSE - DAY 10 Chickens peck the morning dew in the yard around a tin ro shack. This is one in a collection of houses built togeth in a small community. Richard’s car pulls in next to a rusty pickup. He climbs as LOLA(48), a weathered woman already missing teeth, hel very pregnant WHITE GIRL(17) out of the front door.
Hey Momma.
They out back.
Here now. Richard grabs the young Girl’s hand to help her down the porch steps. On the ground, she heads to the pickup.
Thank you Miss Lola. We’1ll see you soon.
We'll be here. As Richard moves around to the back of the house, the Gir cranks up the pickup and rattles away.

The wooden barn has a poured concrete floor showing its conversion to a makeshift garage. The walls are lined wit tools and parts. Raymond takes a bite from a bologna sandwich before ducki under the hood of their Chevy race car parked inside. Richard walks in and surveys the work.
How we doin’?

Get that board and get up under there. See if you can’t get this manifold loose. Richard snags a roller board and wrench from the corner a slides on his back under the front end. The two work in tandem, Raymond from above, Richard from below. They work in silence for awhile. Then...
I’m gonna take Mildred up to D.C. to get married. Raymond takes this in, but doesn’t stop working.
You sure about that?
Yeah. Raymond lifts the part out and carries it to a table.
Hold on, stay under there. Raymond returns with another piece that he drops under th hood. Richard, with no need for explanation, grabs the pi and starts to affix it to the car.
You need a witness?
No. I was gonna ask her Dad to come with us. As they continue to work, Virgil enters the barn. He immediately finds Raymond’s sandwich. He picks it up and smells it.
Rich is gonna take Mildred up to D.C. to get married. Virgil takes a bite. With a full mouth...
String Bean? That don’t make no damn sense.  12 13 Virgil chunks the rest of the sandwich into a metal bin a walks back out of the garage. Trailing off...

You'd be livin’ up in da house wit no wife jus’ fine ‘fore you'd... Virgil is gone before concluding his thought. Richard, st tucked under the car, smiles to himself. I/E. RICHARD’S CAR/HIGHWAY TO D.C. - DAY 12 Richard drives on the open highway with the windows down music drifting from the radio. Mildred sits up front next him. They wear their finest clothes. Mildred’s father, THEOLIVER “Jake”(52), rides quietly in backseat. He wears a suit and hat.
You think they’1l see us today?
I called up there.
Seem like a long drive to me.
Thanks for coming Jake.
Daddy what’s the city like? Theoliver shrugs, unimpressed.
It’s fine.

Richard and Mildred stand in front of a MAGISTRATE in the courthouse office. Theoliver stands behind them. Richard slips a slight gold band on Mildred’s finger. She smiles at him, her round belly filling the altered church dress.

By the power vested in me by the District of Columbia, I now pronounce you husband and wife.  14 Al4 10. Richard and Mildred kiss. INT. MILDRED’S PARENTS’ FARMHOUSE - KITCHEN - NIGHT 14 Garnet studies Mildred’s ring as their mother, MUSIEL(46) sits at the table snapping beans.
I may not forgive him.
Come on now.
You lucky if I forgive you. No reason to go all the way up there for this and not take us.
We took Daddy.
Like that means a thing.
Richard said there was less red tape in Washington. That’s all. Garnet, not convinced, tosses Mildred’s hand back at her grabs a fistful of beans to snap. Mildred’s eyes go back the ring.

You can stop lookin’ at it String Bean, you know it’s pretty. Mildred smiles at her sister, using the edge of the table stand. She leans over and gives Garnet a kiss on the forehead before walking out. INT. MILDRED’S PARENTS’ - FRONT ROOM — CONTINUOUS Al4 Theoliver, coat off and tie loose, dozes off in a deep cushioned chair next to a radio in the corner. Richard sits at the dining table under a bare bulb. He’s hunched over a sheet of drafting paper. He moves a pencil around a slide rule sketching plans for their house. Mildred enters and stops to look over his work. She place her hands on his shoulders and leans down to him.  15 16 17 11.
I’m turning in.
What you think about our bedroom in the back?
I'll love it however you make it. She moves away and he grabs her hand, pulling her back in a kiss.
I'll be in there soon.
Okay. Mildred exits to the bedroom. Richard returns to his plan

Bricks laid, mortar spread. It’s a routine at the bustlin job site. Richard moves with the bricks. He barely pauses to run hi sleeve across his brow in the summer heat. INT. MILDRED’S PARENTS’ FARMHOUSE/BEDROOM - DAY 16 Mildred runs fabric through a foot pedal sewing machine. She examines the stitch. Pleased, she carries the blanket over to Garnet who is preparing a basket as a bassinet. Mildred’s hand moves to her stomach, wincing at a kick. Garnet reaches out to feel for herself.
Richard stands at the back of the store scanning a pegboa of automotive belts. He already cradles an assortment of other items.

text: A few CUSTOMERS mingle around. Mildred stands near the do flipping through a box of packets containing clothing patterns. She is being watched by the CASHIER(52), an old black woman smoking a long cigarette.  18 19 12. The Cashier watches Mildred’s fingers flipping through th packets. She sees the ring. Richard approaches Mildred with his items. He stands clos behind her. Mildred removes a pattern to show him.

I thought like this? He nods in agreement and places his hand on the small of back. At this, the Cashier’s mouth furrows. Richard breaks away and walks toward the Cashier. He sets his items on the counter.
Hey Clara. That frame come in for me?
It’s in the back. The Cashier climbs off her stool and shuffles away.

Richard and Raymond work under the body of the race car illuminated by a metal flood lamp. Mildred, in silhouette, leans against a table watching th EXT. LOLA’S HOUSE - DAY 19 Lola dumps a tin of water off the front porch as Richard' car pulls up and parks. He climbs out.
Hey Momma. Richard walks toward the barn in back.
Sheriff's Deputy came by lookin’ for you. This stops him. He turns back to her.
What’d he want?
Wanted to find you.  20 21 13.
You tell him where I was?

I didn’t have nothin’ to tell him. Lola begins scrubbing the tin down. Richard processes this news, unsettled by it. He continue on to the barn. INT. MILDRED’S PARENTS’ FARMHOUSE/BEDROOM - DAY 20 A blank plaster wall. The back of Richard’s head raises up. He hammers at the w for a moment before bending back down leaving a nail in place. He stands back up now holding a large picture frame. He places it on the wall, making sure it’s straight before walking out of the bedroom. Richard and Mildred’s marriage certificate is left hangin there. INT. MILDRED’S PARENTS’ FARMHOUSE - NIGHT 21 Bowls of food are passed for supper at Mildred’s house. H parents, Garnet, Richard, and two cousins, GERALD(27) and DAVIS(22), are all there around the table. It’s a nice meal and everyone seems at ease.
What you like Rich? Ford or Chevy?
Not much difference.
But which one faster?
That just depend on who built it.
That’s what I said.
How much money you win with that car?  22 23 24 25 14.
Boy why you askin’ him ‘bout his money?
He don’t have to answer me. (back to Richard) How many races you won? Richard looks up from his plate for the first time. He ta time to calculate on his fingertips.

A lot. This makes Mildred laugh. EXT. MILDRED’S PARENTS’ FARMHOUSE - NIGHT 22 It’s late. The farmhouse is dark and the surrounding countryside is even darker. The night is hot and still. INT. MILDRED’S PARENTS’ FARMHOUSE - CONTINUOUS 23 The front room is dark. The icebox hums in the kitchen.
In the bedroom, Richard and Mildred sleep soundly. EXT. MILDRED’S PARENTS’ FARMHOUSE - CONTINUOUS 25

head_text.subj: ON THE DIRT DRIVE LEADING UP TO THE HOUSE,

text: Two police cars are parked off to the side under the tree No headlights. No engines running. After a moment, the doors open and THREE MEN quietly step out. Two from the first car and one from the second. They walk toward the house in the dark.

A hand reaches for the front door. It turns the knob. The unlocked door falls open.  26 15. The Men enter. INT. MILDRED’S PARENTS’ FARMHOUSE/BEDROOM - NIGHT 26 Richard and Mildred sleep undisturbed. Still no sounds in the house. Until...
The bedroom door is kicked open as blinding flashlights p on.

In here! The Three Men rush inside. Richard sits up, a hand out to shield his squinting eyes. SHERIFF BROOKS (CONT’D) What you doin’ in that bed boy? Richard is yanked out of the bed wearing only boxers and undershirt. Off balance, he’s slung to the floor.
Richard?
(to Mildred) Get outta that bed. Mildred, wearing a nightgown, slowly climbs out of the be SHERIFF BROOKS (CONT’D) (over Richard) What’re you doin’ in bed with that woman?
I'm his wife. Richard points to the wall leading SHERIFF BROOK’s flashl up to the framed marriage certificate.

That’s no good here. Get your pants on boy. The other two men, a DEPUTY and the COUNTY JAILER, pick Richard up by the arms as he scrambles to put on the work pants he’d left over a chair.  27 28 16. Mildred’s father appears in the doorway as Sheriff Brooks leads her out of the bedroom in her nightgown. Theoliver steps out of the way, saying nothing as Richard led out behind her.

The two police cars are parked in a dirt lot behind the r bricked county jail. Richard and Mildred, both in handcuffs, have been carried separate vehicles. They are removed from their respective backseats by the Deputy and Jailer. Sheriff Brooks, with no comment, walks off toward an adja parking lot as the prisoners are led around front. A bare bulb mounted above the barred door is all that lig the dark, two story structure. Bars cover the windows on second floor.

The jail is dark and dank. The large metal front door opens directly onto a flight o concrete steps that lead up to the cells. The barred wind offer no protection from the elements. Metal creaks as Richard is the first to enter and be led upstairs. Mildred is close behind. A tiny, single cell waits at the top. The Jailer holding Richard addresses the Deputy.
She goes in there. Richard is turned and taken further inside toward a large communal cell down the hall. Richard strains to turn back He’s able to catch Mildred’s eye.

It’s all right. Mildred, still in her slippers and nightgown, looks terrified. The Deputy unlocks the door to her cell. Richard tries to keep an eye on her as the Jailer removes handcuffs and unlocks the communal cell.  29 30 17. Richard is pushed inside.

Richard immediately turns back to the bars being slammed his face. He tries to see down the hall to Mildred but can’t. He steps back, his eyes darting around trying to find an answer that isn’t coming. He brings his hand up to his fa to cover his hurried breathing. Stuck, he begins to gather himself. He turns to the large open cell. Shadowy FIGURES line the walls and pace around the windows. Mostly drunks, one mumbles in the corner. Richard backs into an open spot on the wall by the door. leans there, keeping his eyes on the room.
Mildred is balled up in the corner. The cell is barely bi enough to contain the filthy cot she’s huddled on. She's trembling, trying to control her tears.
Outside, the town of Bowling Green is quiet. The jail sits just a few yards away from the county courthouse. A statue of a confederate soldier stands betw the two buildings.

Sunlight streams through the bars of the communal cell. Richard hasn’t moved from his spot on the wall. Several other MEN, black and white, are sprawled out across the c The sound of traffic bustles from the town outside. Richard barely moves his head at the sound of the big met door downstairs opening. Footsteps climb the steps in no kind of hurry. Keys jingle and the cell door opens.
Richard Loving?  18.
Here. Richard straightens, stiff from the long night, and moves the door.
You made bail. Richard quickly steps out of the cell and moves down the looking for Mildred. He sees her still huddled on the cot in her cell.
Bean? Mildred lifts her head to find Richard approaching. She immediately gets to her feet and goes to the cell door.
Richard? As Richard approaches her, the Jailer grabs him by the shoulder to steer him downstairs.
On down. Richard resists.
What about her?
Just you.
Richard? The Jailer moves Richard further down the stairs. Richard tries to pull back.
Wait. The Jailer yanks his arm.
Don’t pull me again.
That’s not right.  31 32 33 19. The Jailer moves him on downstairs. Richard turns to see Mildred. She stands at the bars watching him go.
That's not right now! At the bottom of the steps he loses sight of her. The Jai shoves him outside.

Richard stumbles out the door into bright sunlight. He covers his eyes as the metal door slams shut. The Jailer keeps a hold of him and leads him across the l toward the courthouse. Richard looks over to the small Sheriff's office that sit a building behind the jail. Sheriff Brooks stands outside sipping a cup of coffee. He watches Richard. Richard averts his eyes. INT. CAROLINE COUNTY COURTHOUSE/CLERK’S OFFICE - DAY 32 Richard stands in front of a desk in the CLERK’s office collecting his wallet and keys.
Sign at the bottom. The Clerk, a white man in his early 60's, presents a pape and pen to him. Richard bends over to sign.
What about my wife?
You'll have to talk to the Judge about that on Monday.
Monday? Richard waits for a response, but the Clerk just hands hi receipt for his things. Richard walks out.

Richard walks outside to find Raymond waiting for him by car on the street.  34 35 20. They don’t speak. They just climb in the car and Raymond drives away. INT. LOLA’S HOUSE - LATE AFTERNOON 34 A scream. The pregnant young White Girl sits in a bed in the center the front room in the midst of labor. Her HUSBAND(25) sta by looking pale. Lola performs her midwife duties in the middle of it all.
Richard! Richard enters from the front porch.

Bring me that fresh water and take this one out. Richard moves to the wood stove and a uses a towel to gra the fresh bucket of water. He replaces it with one at Lol feet and heads back out to the front porch. EXT. LOLA’S HOUSE - CONTINUOUS 35 Richard walks onto the porch and dumps the bucket off to side of the house. Setting the bucket down, he joins Raymond on the railing looking out over the small community of houses. SEVERAL PEOPLE mill about.
What you gon’ do? Richard shakes his head, unable to unclench his jaw. He studies the people in the nearby houses, black and white. All poor.
How'd they know to come get us?

Somebody talked. Richard looks at him. Nods. He turns his attention back to the neighbors. The sounds the Girl’s labor continue inside.  36 37 38 39 21. INT. LOLA’S HOUSE - NIGHT 36 Lola has cleaned up the room from the birth. By the light of a bare bulb, she folds a clean sheet and places it in a large wooden chest. EXT. LOLA’S HOUSE - CONTINUOUS 37 Richard sits alone on a stoop smoking at the back of the house. The moon is bright. His mind works on the problem. Stumped, he stands with a flick of his cigarette and begi to pace. His head moves as if making an argument with no words. He finally sits back on the stoop and stares up at the mo He rubs his fingers over his face. From inside, Lola watches her son through the screen of t back door. She returns to her work.
Mildred tries to straighten a stiff leg while leaning on edge of the cot in the cramped cell. She massages her bel with a wince.
Mildred flinches at the sound from down the hall. A shout match erupts between two men in the communal cell.

Mumbling. Someone laughs. Then silence. Mildred draws back onto the cot, trying to make herself small. INT. CAROLINE COUNTY COURTHOUSE/CLERK’S OFFICE - DAY 39 Richard stands in front of the Clerk’s desk already frustrated by the situation.
We told you to come back on Monday and talk to the Judge.  40 4l 22.
I can’t let her be in there ‘til Monday. That’s not right.
Talk to the Judge. You’re not allowed to bail her out.
I get a lawyer?

You can. Richard swallows his frustration and walks out. EXT. COURTHOUSE/CLERK’S OFFICE - CONTINUOUS 40 Richard storms out of the clerk’s office door. He stops t take a breath, trying to stay calm. He moves across the l toward his car parked on the main street.

Hey boy! Richard stops to see Sheriff Brooks standing outside his office. Richard doesn’t move. The Sheriff beckons him. SHERIFF BROOKS (CONT’D) Come on! Richard watches the Sheriff walk back into his office. He looks around, then walks over. INT. SHERIFF’S OFFICE - DAY 4l Richard steps inside to find Sheriff Brooks seated behind desk. They are alone.

Sit down. Richard takes a seat in front of the desk, apprehensive. SHERIFF BROOKS (CONT’D) You back tryin’ to bail her out? Richard nods.  23. SHERIFF BROOKS (CONT’D) You know they aren’t gonna let her out to you? Richard wants to protest, but doesn’t. SHERIFF BROOKS (CONT’D) You best send one of her people up here, ‘cause they won’t let her out to you.
She’s pregnant.

You shut your mouth about that. I'll throw your ass back in there for that. You know better. Richard mumbles something. SHERIFF BROOKS (CONT’D) What’s that? Richard says nothing. SHERIFF BROOKS (CONT’D) You do know better don’t you? Or Maybe you don’t. Your daddy worked for a nigger didn’t he? Runnin’ timber? The Sheriff shakes his head, feigning remorse. SHERIFF BROOKS (CONT’D) I’m sorry for you. I really am. All ya'll over there in Central Point don’t know up from down. All mixed up. Half Cherokee, Rappahannock, part niggra, part white. Blood don’t know what it wants to be. You just got born in the wrong place is all. Richard stays still. SHERIFF BROOKS (CONT’D) See you got to thinkin’ it was fine. You might think people around here wouldn’t care. Hell maybe they wouldn't if your dumb country ass hadn’t gone off and married her, but not me. You hear me? That’s God’s law. (MORE )

42 43 44 45 24. SHERIFF BROOKS (CONT’D) He made a sparrow a sparrow and a robin a robin. They’re different for a reason. The Sheriff stares him down, just hoping he makes eye contact, but Richard never does. SHERIFF BROOKS (CONT’D) No. No. You go on now. Get on home. Richard lifts from the chair but is stopped at the door. SHERIFF BROOKS (CONT’D) You send some of her people down here tomorrow to get her. I see you try and bail her out again I'll arrest you. Richard exits.
Richard walks across the lawn. He looks up at the jail, b doesn’t stop moving.
Richard lays brick. He’s off his pace. His mind wanders.

Richard sits alone in his car at night. The engine is off and light from a distant street lamp ba illuminates him. His arm is propped on the door and he holds his head. He’ been here awhile. His eyes eventually drift to something across the street. He is parked on the main street of Bowling Green. In the distance, he watches the jail.

Daylight streams in through the bars. Mildred sits in the cell.  46 47 25. She jumps at the sound of the loud metal door opening downstairs. She leans over to see who will appear. Sheriff Brooks walks a PRISONER up. The Prisoner doesn’t take his eyes off Mildred. The Sheriff notices.

I should let you go in there with her tonight. This said, the Sheriff never stops walking and disappears with the Prisoner down the hall. Mildred retreats to the back corner of her cell. Her eyes stay locked on the empty hallway. It’s quiet. Sheriff Brooks reappears in the hallway. He’s alone. He walks up to Mildred’s cell and unlocks the door. She stares up at him with wide eyes. She can’t get any furthe away but tries. Pressing her back into the wall. Sheriff Brooks swings the bars open and takes a step back After a moment... SHERIFF BROOKS (CONT’D) Come on. Your daddy posted your bail. Mildred pauses, unsure, but then bolts up and is moving d the stairs. INT. CAROLINE COUNTY COURTHOUSE/CLERK’S OFFICE - DAY 46 The doors open and Mildred steps inside the Clerk’s offic Theoliver is waiting there. She runs up and embraces him. She's crying. He holds her. I/E. THEOLIVER’S CAR/COUNTRYSIDE - DAY 47 Theoliver drives as Mildred stares out the passenger wind They ride in silence. Mildred watches the trees and countryside passing by outs It’s a beautiful summer day.  48 49 50

EXT. MILDRED’S PARENTS’ FARMHOUSE - DAY 48 Mildred gets out of the car. Garnet rushes off the front porch to give her a hug. Mild accepts this but cranes her neck, searching. Musiel steps out onto the porch alone.
Where’s Richard? Theoliver walks up to the house and doesn’t stop to speak
Moved his things out. Theoliver continues inside the house. Mildred looks confused. Garnet takes her hand and leads her to the hous

Said they’d arrest ya'll again if they catch him here with you. Mildred stops on the porch and looks back to the road. No one is there, but it doesn’t stop her from searching. Gar takes her on inside. EXT. LOLA’S HOUSE - NIGHT 49 The sound of crickets fill the warm night air. Richard steps quietly out the back door of his mother’s house. He waits on the top step, scanning the other house There is no one around. He moves quickly away from the house and disappears into treeline that borders the community.
Richard moves through dark woods. Branches and brambles p at his pants and scratch his arms.

Richard pauses to survey a road in the distance. Headlights appear and he crouches. The car passes without slowing. Richard waits to be sure, and then sprints out of the woods.  51 52 53 27. He crosses the road and enters the treeline on the opposi side. He falls out of sight. EXT. MILDRED’'S PARENTS’ FARMHOUSE - NIGHT 51 Richard appears from the woods on the side of Mildred’s parents’ house. He hangs close to the trees as he maneuvers to a spot whe he can see the dirt drive. It’s empty. Richard moves toward the front door. He eases open the screen slips inside. INT. MILDRED’S PARENTS’ FARMHOUSE - CONTINUOUS 52 The house is dark and quiet, similar to the night they we arrested. Richard makes his way through, wary of his creaking footsteps. INT. MILDRED'S PARENTS’ FARMHOUSE/BEDROOM - CONTINUOUS 53 Mildred bolts up in bed at the sound of the bedroom door opening.
Bean? Mildred tries to get up but Richard is already beside her She wraps her arms around him tight. She’s crying.
